intro: Angadenia nitida, commonly known as the slender sand mat, is a low-growing perennial herb native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Angadenia nitida is often found in open habitats such as sandplains and rocky outcrops.
